remarks: The graph with one edge, analogous to ~ umgra1 ( with additional assumption that ` B =/= C ` since otherwise the edge is a loop!). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Aug-2017.)  (Proof shortened by Alexander van der Vekens, 16-Dec-2017.)
statement: usgra1 $p |- ( ( ( V e. W /\ A e. X ) /\ ( B e. V /\ C e. V ) ) -> ( B =/= C -> V USGrph { <. A , { B , C } >. } ) ) $.
